briefing.opening: Good morning/afternoon/evening. Welcome to the climate briefing for January 1, 2026.

sections.title: ğŸ‡°ğŸ‡· Accelerating the Transition to a Carbon-Neutral Society
sections.content: According to news released today, Minister Kim Seong-hwan declared 2026 as the inaugural year of a 'Green Great Transformation,' stating that all efforts would be made to leap forward as a leading nation in carbon neutrality and to establish a carbon-neutral energy mix through the harmonious integration of renewable energy and nuclear power [4, 5, 18]. Nationwide efforts to implement carbon neutrality are materializing, with Gyeonggi Province enforcing revised urban and county master plan guidelines, including the transition to carbon-neutral cities, starting this new year. Soonchunhyang University and Korea Western Power are also strengthening cooperation to build carbon-neutral campuses [2, 3, 11, 14]. Industrial participation is also active, with Gumi City accelerating its transformation into a carbon-neutral future industrial city through advanced industries such as robotics and secondary batteries, and the mechanical equipment industry emerging as a key player in the era of carbon neutrality [6, 9]. Furthermore, Jeju Province is promoting the integration of carbon neutrality with the local economy, and Yecheon County has completed a private-led carbon-neutral village pilot project, focusing on building community and citizen-participatory models [8, 10]. Notably, a policy offering an additional 1 million KRW in support for converting internal combustion engine vehicles to electric vehicles will be implemented starting this year, expected to encourage individual carbon-neutral practices [29].

sections.title: âš ï¸ Challenges in Domestic Renewable Energy and Industrial Sectors
sections.content: Meanwhile, significant challenges persist in the domestic expansion of renewable energy and the carbon-neutral transition of the industrial sector. While Minister Kim Seong-hwan stated a commitment to boldly improve regulations hindering renewable energy expansion [22], concerns have been raised that industrial and market perspectives are not sufficiently considered in current renewable energy policies [26]. Specifically, despite plans to establish a 10-gigawatt (GW) renewable energy complex in Saemangeum, Gunsan, Jeonbuk, worries are emerging that the 'power highway' is severely congested due to insufficient grid infrastructure, anticipating difficulties in power transmission [27]. In the industrial sector, under carbon neutrality pressure, the steel industry views hydrogen reduction ironmaking as an essential transformation for survival [7], and the 'K-battery' industry also began the new year in a somber mood, with a gloomy outlook continuing [28]. Furthermore, a projection suggests that the increasing power consumption of Artificial Intelligence (AI) necessitates the full mobilization of all energy sources, including nuclear power, renewable energy, and hydrogen [21]. The argument for continuous management of climate response projects in the Chungnam region [1] and instances where factory rooftop solar installations fail to meet specific qualification requirements [23] illustrate potential issues arising during the practical implementation of domestic climate policies.

sections.title: ğŸ”´ Global Climate Change Crisis and Warning Signs
sections.content: Globally, the warning signs of climate change are growing louder. Rising temperatures in Amazonian lakes are observed as a red flag for climate change [34], and in 2025, analysis indicated that climate change played a key role in several major weather phenomena [35]. In Minnesota, a common weather system, the clipper, transformed into a super-powerful snowstorm due to climate change [36], and the interaction between El NiÃ±o and climate change continues to be discussed [31]. Research published on the Qinghai-Tibet Plateau revealed that the interaction between climate change and human activities negatively impacted plant diversity [38], and the Baltic Sea is continuously threatened by global warming and human waste [50]. Despite these circumstances, a critical perspective exists that humanity tends to continue ignoring the physical principles of climate change [42], suggesting an urgent need for a fundamental shift in humanity's approach to the climate crisis.

sections.title: ğŸŒ International Climate Action and Policy Trends
sections.content: The international community continues various efforts to address climate change. In 2025, despite setbacks in federal policy, progress was reported in climate change response measures at the city and state levels [32]. In Canada's Paulatuk region, practical adaptation efforts are underway, such as the construction of new 'mini bridges' to help hunters adapt to climate change [49, 51]. Meanwhile, federal rulings have repeatedly blocked Hawaii's imposition of a climate change tourism tax on cruise ships [30, 39, 40, 44, 46, 47], illustrating the legal and economic complexities of implementing climate policies. On a positive note, despite disruptions in clean energy supply during a year of climate extremes, a report indicated a decrease in heatwave-related deaths [41], and private-sector actions are also active, with women engineers donating 100 tree saplings [52]. Furthermore, research suggesting that forcing lifestyle changes can weaken support for climate action [45] highlights the importance of a multifaceted approach to effective climate action.

briefing.closing: Today's climate news has highlighted the acceleration of the carbon neutrality transition both domestically and internationally, alongside warnings about the intensifying impacts of climate change, and the diverse efforts and challenges in addressing them. This concludes the climate briefing for January 1, 2026.

articles.original_title: ìƒˆë§Œê¸ˆì— 10GW â€˜ì—ë„ˆì§€ ê³µë£¡â€™ ì„¸ìš´ë‹¤ì§€ë§ŒÂ·Â·Â·â€œì „ë ¥ ê³ ì†ë„ë¡œëŠ” ê½‰ ë§‰í˜”ë‹¤â€
articles.description: Government Accelerates Creation of RE100 Complexes Including Tidal Power... Environmental Groups: "Practical Decentralization Strategy Needed Over Political Declarations" - Overview of a floating solar power plant installed in a retention basin within the Saemangeum National Industrial Complex 2 in Gunsan, Jeollabuk-do. Provided by Saemangeum Development and Investment Agency. Regarding the government's plan to create a 10-gigawatt (GW) renewable energy complex in Saemangeum to establish a 'national representative RE100 (100% of electricity used sourced from renewable energy)' model...

summary.phenomenon: The government plans to develop a 10-gigawatt (GW) renewable energy complex in Saemangeum, Gunsan, Jeollabuk-do, to create a national RE100 model. However, difficulties in power transmission are anticipated due to insufficient grid infrastructure.
summary.outlook: Environmental groups argue that the government's plan should not remain a political declaration but requires a practical decentralization strategy, warning that without expanding grid infrastructure, the establishment of large-scale renewable energy complexes may face setbacks.

articles.title: Gloomy Outlook Continues into New Year... 'K-Battery' Starts in a Somber Mood
articles.original_title: ìƒˆí•´ì—ë„ ì¿ë¹› ì „ë§â€¦ìš°ìš¸í•œ ë¶„ìœ„ê¸°ë¡œ ì¶œë°œí•˜ëŠ” â€˜K-ë°°í„°ë¦¬â€™
articles.description: SK On's 'BlueOval SK' Tennessee plant, which will transition from a joint operation with Ford to independent operation in Q1 this year. Provided by SK On. The outlook for the domestic battery industry remains bleak. The global EV 'chasm' (demand stagnation) persists, and external factors such as delayed electrification policies in the US and the rapid advance of Chinese batteries present significant challenges. With increasing uncertainty in the North American market, where large-scale investments have been made or are planned, the industry faces mounting pressure...

summary.phenomenon: The outlook for the domestic battery industry remains bleak as the new year begins, with a somber atmosphere prevailing.
summary.cause: A combination of external factors is at play, including the global electric vehicle demand stagnation (chasm), delayed electrification policies in the United States, the rapid growth of the Chinese battery industry, and increasing uncertainty in the North American market.
summary.outlook: With growing uncertainty in the North American market, where significant investments have been made or are planned, the domestic battery industry is expected to face considerable challenges.

articles.title: Switching from Internal Combustion Engine Vehicles to EVs to Receive 1 Million Won in Additional Support Starting This Year
articles.description: An EV charging station in Seoul. Yonhap News. Starting this new year, individuals who switch from internal combustion engine vehicles to electric vehicles can receive an additional 1 million won on top of existing EV subsidies. The Ministry of Climate, Energy, and Environment (Climate Ministry) announced on the 1st the '2026 Electric Vehicle Purchase Subsidy Reform Plan,' which includes the introduction of a 'conversion support fund' for switching from ICE vehicles to EVs. The per-unit budget support for EV subsidies will remain the same as last year. The Climate Ministry...

summary.phenomenon: An EV charging station in Seoul. Yonhap News. Starting this new year, individuals who switch from internal combustion engine vehicles to electric vehicles can receive an additional 1 million won on top of existing EV subsidies. The Ministry of Climate, Energy, and Environment (Climate Ministry) announced the '2026 Electric Vehicle Purchase Subsidy Reform Plan,' which includes the introduction of a 'conversion support fund' for switching from ICE vehicles to EVs.
